title: Mexico president lashes out after thousands protest in pro-democracy rallies
description: Mexico's President López Obrador lashed out at thousands who protested on Sunday over cuts to election funding, belittling concerns about threats to democracy.

title: Andrew Tate detained for another 30 days by a Romanian court over human trafficking allegations
description: A Romanian court on Monday upheld a third 30-day detention for the divisive influencer and former professional kickboxer Andrew Tate, who is held on suspicion of organized crime and human trafficking, an official said.

title: U.K. and E.U. strike deal over Northern Ireland in potential post-Brexit breakthrough
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has struck a new deal on post-Brexit trade rules for Northern Ireland, gambling that the reward of better ties with the European Union is worth any discord it might cause within his own party.

title: South Korean gay couple sees court win as breakthrough for equality
description: In a landmark decision, Seoul High Court ruled that the state’s health insurer should provide spousal coverage to same-sex couple So Sung-uk and Kim Yong-min

title: Mexicans turn out in droves to protest electoral overhaul as they see democracy at risk
description: Huge crowds gathered in Mexico on Sunday to condemn government moves to shrink the electoral authority as a threat to democracy, in what appeared to be the largest protest so far against President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s administration.

title: Israeli settlers rampage through Palestinian town in revenge for West Bank shooting
description: Dozens of Israeli settlers embarked on a violent rampage through the Palestinian town of Hawara after the shooting of two Israeli settlers.

title: Death toll at 62 after migrant shipwreck off Italy with dozens more missing
description: The death toll rose to 62 in the migrant tragedy off Italy’s southern coast after rescue crews recovered three more bodies on Monday, driving home once again the desperate and dangerous boat crossings of people seeking to reach Europe.

title: China accuses U.S. of ‘disinformation’ over warnings it’s considering sending artillery and ammo to Russia
description: China denied U.S. claims that it is considering sending Russia artillery and ammunition for its war against Ukraine, saying it is promoting peace talks.

title: BTS member j-hope begins process to join South Korean military
description: A second member of South Korean K-pop group BTS, j-hope, has begun the enlistment process for mandatory military service, a management official confirmed.

title: This tech company has a daily message for employees: ‘Please go home!’
description: An Indian tech company is trying to promote work-life balance among employees with pop-up software reminding them to go home at the end of their shifts.

title: Missing Chinese billionaire is cooperating with authorities in an investigation, his bank says
description: China Renaissance Holdings said that its missing chairman and star dealmaker Bao Fan was cooperating with Chinese authorities conducting an investigation.

title: Mexican president posts photo of what he claims is an elf
description: Mexico’s president posted a photo on his social media accounts Saturday showing what he said appeared to be a mythological woodland spirit similar to an elf.

title: Afghan refugees in Pakistan protest delay in U.S. resettlement
description: Hundreds of Afghan refugees facing extreme delays in the approval of U.S. visas protested in Pakistan’s capital, as an American program to help them stalls.

title: Russian-released video shows what remains of Bakhmut
description: In an interview that aired Sunday, President Putin told Russian state TV that the goal of Western countries is to disband the former Soviet Union and the Russian Federation. Three intelligence officials tell NBC News, China is considering sending artillery and ammunition to Russia, which China denies. President Zelenskyy is vowing to liberate Russian-occupied Crimea and return the “Ukrainian flag to every corner of Ukraine,” while the U.S. reiterated its support.
